conversation.content: Um, hi, I'm—sorry, I'm calling because, uh, my account got suspended? And I didn't—I mean, um, there wasn't any warning or...
Right, um, let me just, uh, pull that up here... hmm, what's your account number or, um, email address so I can, er, take a look at what happened?
It's—wait, sorry, the email is j.martinez at—no, actually jmart2847@gmail.com
Got it. So I'm seeing account ID ACC-7739-MX21 here, and it looks like there was a security flag triggered on November 15th at 2:47 PM.
Security flag? I don't—um, I mean, I'm sorry but like, what does that even, uh, what did I do wrong?
Well, um, let me see here... so basically, uh, the system detected, hmm, multiple login attempts from, er, different countries within like a really short timeframe?
Different countries? But I haven't—I mean I've just been home, I haven't traveled anywhere.
Right right. So looking at the logs here, we've got attempts from Brazil, Turkey, and Vietnam all within about thirty minutes on that date.
Oh god, um, does that mean someone was, like, trying to hack me? I'm so sorry, I should've—uh, I probably should've had better security or, um...
Um, well actually, hmm, between you and me? This happens, uh, way more than you'd think. Let me just, er, check something else here...
So can you—sorry, can you just turn it back on then? Since it wasn't actually me?
Unfortunately I can't just reactivate it immediately, but what I can do is submit a priority review ticket PRV-88264-QN for you.
Priority review? How long—um, sorry, I don't mean to be difficult but like, how long is that going to, uh, take exactly?
So, um, normally it's 3-5 business days but, uh, hmm, let me see if I can, er, escalate this a bit for you...
Three to five days. Of course. That's... perfectly reasonable.
Okay okay. I'm marking this as urgent review code URG-5512-XT, which should bump you to the front of the queue, probably within 24 hours.
Oh—um, really? That's, uh, I mean thank you, I'm sorry for being, um, short with you earlier, I just...
No no, um, totally get it. Er, losing account access is, uh, super frustrating. Also, hmm, while we're at it, um, might wanna change that password once you're back in?
Yes, definitely—wait, sorry, will I get an email when it's reactivated or do I need to check—
Absolutely. You'll get a notification to that gmail address with confirmation number CNF-9947-BK22, and then just follow the steps to set up two-factor authentication.

scenario: asking why their account was suspended without warning
